name: Apex International Hotel

reviews.text: We were in the superior rooms on the 5th floor and it was pure luxury to be able to lie in bed and look out over the view of the castle... Brilliant. The breakfast was good with a buffet and cooked options. Staff were really helpful and friendly especially I ally with my elderly mum. Room was extremely clean and had everything we needed including elemis toiletries. It is situated on Grassmarket with some brilliant restaurants around especially the mussel and steak restaurant up the road. We had a great holiday!
reviews.title: Brilliant view of the castle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Apex International Edinburgh for 2 nights in September 2013.
reviews.title: Excellent location, wonderful view for breakfast!

reviews.text: The hotel location is excellent, situated very close to the Royal Mile and the Castle. However, not ideal for those that cannot walk up and down hills as the hotel is located within the Grassmarket which is situated quite literally in the shadow of the castle and you must walk up quite a steep hill, or a large number of steps to reach the Royal Mile itself.
reviews.title: Short Stay for Family Wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was well appointed and clean and the bed was comfortable. Our Biscuits and tea and coffee were topped up each day.
reviews.title: Great location for walking!

reviews.text: We had booked on a room only basis but decided to add Breakfast to that on our first morning, and I am so glad that we did. The view from the window of the dining room was spectacular, the picture of this from the Hotel's own website is entirely accurate and is worth the price of breakfast alone!
reviews.title: Ok

reviews.text: I have stayed here after I have read some reviews, especially of "Don´t believe the web site ..."
reviews.title: Can't believe the world has so stupid people

reviews.text: I really cannot believe the world has so stupid people, well, that person is from America, what else should I say!
reviews.title: Internet prices outrageous!
Don't believe the web site!
reviews.text: Have checked their web site, it says, the leisure area will be open in late autumm. I know, and as everybody else knows, late autumm in San Diego is July!

But indeed the hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of the castle and the Royal Mile. The rooms are in high standard, okay, there´s no aircon, but be honest, do you need it here in Scotland?
reviews.title: Great location, alright to sleep
If You Want to Stay in a Noisy Sauna....
reviews.text: What does people expect if they get a room overlooking a wall from a city centre hotel? Some people expect always the best from the best. If you wanna have a great view, why not book into a golf resort in the middle of nowhere? Well, but than, there´s no city centre location, strange? Americans, no comment.
I have stayed at the Apex International twice for business and would be happy to return for business or leisure.
reviews.title: Good stay for business

reviews.text: The hotel has an amazing location on Edinburgh’s Grassmarket and is in easy reach of the Old Town, Royal Mile, the castle and, of course, all of the fantastic restaurants on Grassmarket itself. The hotel reception is nice and the staff are efficient. The only downside is that there are quite a few steps to climb to get to the reception which can be tricky with a suitcase, and a few steps more to get to the lifts so not sure how well disabled guests are catered for.
reviews.title: Good value, location and facilities

reviews.text: The rooms themselves are very spacious. I have stayed on the fourth floor on both occasions and always found it to be quiet. The hotel itself has a view of the castle, best displayed in its restaurant on the fifth floor, but neither I nor people I have been staying with have had a view from the bedrooms. The rooms come with a huge bed, plenty of storage space and a great bathroom with Elemis products. Tea, coffee, hot chocolate and water are all complimentary in the rooms. Only grumble I have is that the pillows, although looking huge and fluffy, go flat the second you lay on them so bring your own if you have particular requirements.
reviews.title: Good for tourists, bad for business
Great location but a noisy location
reviews.text: I haven’t dined at the hotel but the breakfast is excellent. There is a cold buffet or cooked selection, which is ordered and served to you, and the pancakes are yummy. The bar downstairs is modern and chic with a fantastic range of drinks. I’m always a fan of places that serve Grey Goose vodka so was easily won over.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel also has a small swimming pool and a ‘gym’. The gym is a small room in the basement with frankly inadequate air-conditioning and I would recommend only using this if you really, really feel the need to exercise. The pool is small although you do have a view of the castle as you swim so is rather nice. The changing rooms are not though. Tiny and cramped, these are best avoided if at all possible and rather let the entire fitness and relaxation element of the hotel down.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice! What a view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was a little in need of refurbishment, but nice and also chic. The location can not be beat in my opinion, the staff was nice. One odd thing we noticed in the UK, no clocks in the room so you will be dependent on wake up calls if you dont bring a mini clock or something (our phones didnt work over there). The bed is a bit lumpy and springy, but overall we were comfy and would stay here again. You are right near the royal mile for all of your wool needs and Princes Street for something a bit more updated.
reviews.title: A little in need of update, but a very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Apex Int, for two nights over a recent weekend in Nov. Now there is nothing wrong with the hotel at all, its clean the staff are polite and helpful. The gym was better than average and the pool ok too. However for just over £100 per night i would have expected a little more. The room was nothing special, thats not to say it was bad. Its was just average, reasonably modern looking and with a good bed. The problem we found that there wasn't much to rave about the place, its a 4-star hotel but we didn't feel like we were staying at a 4 star place. People were queuing to get into the breakfast room, which is something that i haven't seen before.
reviews.title: Good location, but not what we expected

likes.liked: — Good location and the castle is right outside of your window

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Apex was just ok, which is fine but for £100 a night even in Edinburgh I am sure there are better places. That said, if you not too worried about the cost then this place is a very safe bet in terms of the overall package.
reviews.title: Great location- Great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location-wise its great though. Right on the Grassmarket, plenty of drink and eating options right by and of course the hotel is over looked by the castle.
reviews.title: visit the apex

reviews.text: We had a great time in Edinburgh, but can't help feeling the hotel could have been a bit better.
reviews.title: Some nice touches, but not a 4 star hotel

likes.liked: — the free water in the room

reviews.title: Great location in the Old town
reviews.text: Staying at the hotel in charge of a conference/leisure group combined during a weekend the hotel turned out great. Excellent facilities, nice staff and excellent breakfast room as well. Location great. Can be recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We reserved our room with airplane miles so didn't know what to expect. Received excellent room with grand view of Edinburgh Castle. Tour buses stop outside hotel door on Grassmarket. Easy walk to most Old Town features; buses cover the rest efficiently with on-off pass. Remarkably quiet rooms, very helpful service staff.
reviews.title: Close to so much; access to all Edinburgh
Good Festival Venue
reviews.text: Peace and quiet just steps away from the Grassmarket. Pleasant staff. Good airy restaurant and well priced food. Very relaxing. Recommended for those seeking somewhere away from the crowds and the noise !!

What a delight and what a find! Stayed here over the weekend and I was so very pleased with the hotel - the staff were so friendly and helpful - they could not do enough for us - the little touches meant the most- free room upgrades for some of my party and a bottle of bubbles for myself as it was a "special" birthday! Rooms were comfy, clean and spacious with great views overlooking the castle and everything was within walking distance. No issues with outside noise at all..We stayed on a room only basis so cannot comment on the food but the bar was great and reasonably priced.Thank you Apex hotel for making my birthday weekend even more special! This hotel comes highly recommended!
reviews.title: Great hotel and location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I Booked this hotel after looking at lots of hotels in Edinburgh, I paid £230.00 for one night which including Breakfast and a Two course dinner. I was disappointed with the room it was just like a premier inn/holiday inn which I could have booked and it would not have been as expensive. I would not say that the room was a four star and I had paid for a deluxe double room.
reviews.title: HOTEL REVIEW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised by how nice this hotel was. The location was great, tons of bars and restaurants around. Our room was the standard room, facing the courtyard (cheaper). We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I was impressed by The Apex International Hotel, my room was clean and modern, the staff were friendly and the breakfast was good, the view from the 5th floor dining room at breakfast must be as good as you'll find in the city.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel, I'd go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only potential downside could be as its located on Grassmarket where there are numerous bars, the noise levels could be an issue . I mentioned this at check-in and was told that its not bad midweek but can get noisy at weekends, I stayed Tuesday to Thursday and there was a little noise in the early hours of Friday morning and that was a room at the side of the hotel rather than the front, so its a case of what you prefer a room with a great view that could be noisy at night, or a room with not as good a view but gives you a better chance of a decent nights sleep.
reviews.title: Great location, great hotel

reviews.text: All in all a decent hotel, and for the rate I paid worth the money.
reviews.title: a bit tired but good over all

reviews.text: We visited this hotel as a surprise 'celebration package' and so were delighted to find chilled champagne, chocolates and flowers waiting in the room (we took the flowers home and they're still blooming!). We had a super room, with a small balcony, overlooking the Grassmarket square and the castle which is floodlit in the evening.
reviews.title: Good location, castle view

reviews.text: We have just returned from spending 4 nights at this hotel, which I picked after reading positive reviews on TripAdvisor. I had emailed the hotel prior to arrival and confirmed they were happy for us to drop our bags early, which they had no problems with. We were upgraded to a deluxe room with a great view of the castle, so we did overlook Grassmarket. The hotel overall was spotlessly clean and tidy. This area was very busy and quite noisy on our first night but the remaining nights we slept soundly! There was a desk-top fan in the room which we used at night because the room was so warm (and with no heating on!) Breakfast was amazingly good, although a couple of mornings service was a little slow due to the amount of people they had to cater for. The bar area in the evenings was quiet and the barman was very helpful with suggestions of things to do and see in the area. The reception staff were great at all times and very helpful - they were happy for us to leave our bags on our last day and collect them when we were ready for the airport. The restaurants and shops around the Grassmarket area were a good range of prices and tastes - we would definitely recommend 'Made in Italy', the little restaurant opposite the Apex. Don't get caught though by the 'homeless' people that sit outside some of the shops at night, with a few pennies in their hats -I saw someone put some money in which the 'homeless person' grabbed, put in her pocket and then text someone on her mobile!! We would recommend Camera Obscura, the Auld Reckie Ghost Tour and also Dynamic Earth. Overall a great half-term break.
reviews.title: Great hotel in central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A one night stop in Edinburgh on a budget, we were looking to stay in the Grassmarket because we were seeing some music in a local venue. It was just a faultless experience, even although the rooms were not ready at 4pm. We managed to find a space in the "underhotel" carpark, on arrival the lovely ladies on reception were extremely chatty and welcoming without being overfamiliar. We were advised of an upgrade and given a voucher for a drink at the bar to await housekeeping to be ready. Okay it took about 45mins, but we were thankful of the complimentary G&T after a 5 hour drive and quite frankly the atmosphere was so good it wasn't a problem.
reviews.title: Surprise upgrade...excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow, when we saw the room, it had 2 doubles and a view of the castle from floor to ceiling windows to die for. The little bathroom was extremely clean, with Elemis products. The room just had everything we needed (even little earplugs coz we guessed the area does have a buzz at night) For the price we paid, this felt like a real treat. We had a lovely evening, without leaving this wonderful area of Edinburgh.
reviews.title: Amazing service!

reviews.text: We were very impressed with the welcome we had from the young women on reception and at the bar. They are an asset and Apex must be a motivational company to work for (proudly found out its a Scottish company).
reviews.title: Do not book a twin room at this hotel

reviews.text: My husband and I went to Edinburgh for our honeymoon. We spent five nights at the hotel. We had an amazing time. We arrived at 9:00 am after hours of traveling from Florida and we were exhausted. They checked us in early without charging an extra day. It was the perfect location. We were so close to so many great sights, restaurants, and bars. We walked everywhere. The staff was so kind. I can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff, party zone

reviews.text: We booked this hotel at the last minute so were not sure what to expect.
reviews.title: Fantastic view of the castle

reviews.text: Stayed here for a friend's wedding - overall we were disappointed with the hotel. The location is excellent (although can be noisy because of the bars opposite)and the views of the castle are superb. The gym equipment is very new and in good condition. However - the lifts are in desperate need of decorative attention and are very slow. Our bedroom was small and the bathroom in need of updating (my partner went to the gym downstairs every day because the showers were nicer!). Other members of the wedding party complained because of leaking showers and missing toiletries. The cooked breakfast was very greasy and at £11 rather expensive. We were also disappointed with the level of customer service shown by some staff - one waitress in particular in the Heights restaurant was very rude. When compared to other hotels this definitely isn't worth its 4 star rating.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: Have just returned from a weekend in Edinburgh with my boyfriend staying in the Apex International. I had been recommended to stay at this hotel by a work colleague who raved about the view. We had booked an Executive Double and on arrival, informed that we had been upgraded to a Superior Double. Very excited at what was awaiting us......!
reviews.title: The view made up for

reviews.text: Had a drink in the bar then set off to find our luxury room! The place had black marble floors and everything looked a bit dusty and like it needed a good clean. (Bit like black cars...looks fab when you first clean them!) Also, I think you can always tell the standard of the hotel by its lifts....this one was average with mucky hand prints on the mirrors!
reviews.title: 2 nights wasn't enough!!

reviews.text: Our "Superior Double" as far as we could see was what a 4* "standard" room should be, maybe even less. I had just been staying at the Dalmahoy Marriott just outside of Edinburgh for 3 nights with work, and it too was 4* and the room was far better than here. The Superior Double was of a standard size. The paintwork was exceptionally shoddy and first thing you see is paint down the light switch! It had a balcony but in January you whizz out to look at the castle and straight back in again! The bathroom was average but it did have a walk in shower...which gave out as much water as one of those hand held showers you get over the bath! A complete waste! Also, the way the sink was located, you couldn't get close to the mirror to do your make up or shave. Our sink was blocked and we had to ask reception twice to get it fixed. Also, there were no drawers in the room and hardly any hanging space. It was a squeeze with clothes for just two nights. You could also feel the springs in the mattress which wasn't very comfortable.
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel. Great break.
Great Hotel doesn't deserve such negative feedback
reviews.text: Breakfast was an extra £8 for continental (good if you in a rush as good selection, buffet style) and £11 for cooked...but they bring it out to you on a plate and you don't get much for your money.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Apex International hotel and couldn't ask for more. The location was perfect. I was within walking distance of the Royal Mile, Edinburgh Castle, the shops on Princes Street, and Holyrood. The only reason I would take a taxi were if the weather wasn't permitting or because it was late. I'm a female and didn't want to chance my safety over a few pounds. It's also walking distance from Edinburgh Waverly Train station but I wouldn't walk it given the amount of hills involved. If you've got a back pack and are in really good shape then I'd give it a go but otherwise it's worth the 5-6 pound taxi fare. No sense in arriving at the hotel sweaty.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That said here are a few remarks about the hotel itself. I said before the location was perfect. How perfect? Well you can see Edinburgh Castle right from your breakfast table in the Heights Restaurant on the fifth floor. It's a glorious way to wake up in the morning having coffee and croissants. The food service isn't bad. They offer a continental buffet of fruits, cheeses, meats, and bread items. You can order something hot from the menu including the full Scottish brekkie.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms. The room that my sister and I had included two double beds. Plenty of room to spread around and they were very comfortable. Not too hard nor too soft so they provided for a good nights sleep. The bathroom features an outlet for low wattage appliances like shavers. Nothing too intense like a hair dryer. Normally you'd find a hair dryer in the bathroom but ours was found on the right side under a flap in the wood desk. Once you opened the flap there was also a place to rest a curling iron as well. It was pretty nifty to find. On the other side of the desk was another flap that opened to a power strip. Enough outlets to power a laptop and two mobile phones independently. There was also an outlet by the bed to charge your laptop whilst using it. That made for a very convenient stay. My room was of the standard variety and did NOT include a refrigerator or microwave. I suspect the deluxe rooms had those amenities. We did have access to an electric kettle and a variety of coffee, tea, and hot chocolate to choose from. You'll find an outlet for the kettle in the closets or you may use it on the desk. Speaking of closets, you'll find an ironing board and iron as well.
reviews.title: One of the best places we've stayed!!

reviews.text: My room was quiet and there was very if not any noise to contend with. I was very pleased with this hotel and the amount of room my hotel provided. It was very spacious and allowed me to spread out. I'd definitely choose this hotel again for the convenience and price.
reviews.title: Great location to explore the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this for our tenth wedding anniversary and got a very good advanced rate in a superior room with views of the castle.
reviews.title: Brilliant stay

reviews.text: Not sure how this hotel earned the TripAdvisor excellence award that convinced me to book it.
reviews.title: Value for money... if nothing else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Any hotel that greets you with earplugs is surely a warning sign. The hotel itself is friendly and caters to all the major amenities including free wifi and gym/pool, but location is a bit suboptimal and potentially very noisy at weekends from pubs and bars just opposite.
reviews.title: Very Good......but just a few minor issues!

reviews.text: Hotel decoration is a bit dated and clearly hasn't had an update in a few years - not exactly out of fashion, but a lot of marked walls and chipped paint to anyone taking anything more than the quickest of looks. Reasonable value for money, but worth staying a bit more central if you can afford it!
reviews.title: Good hotel for Business or Pleasure

reviews.text: We have just returned from a 3 night stay. The staff are excellent, and a special mention to all reception staff, but especially Karen who advised of good places to eat, and was very friendly with nothing too much trouble. We were on the 5th floor, with amazing views from the room overlooking the Castle. The room was a touch small, and lacked in storage space, and no room for chairs or a table. so you are forced to sit on the bed as there is nowhere else. That said the view is incredible. Another niggle was the wierd positioning of the TV, not at the end of the bed, but on the wall to the side....this does tend to give you a cricked neck! The lack of room affected my partner more than me, in terms of getting ready at night!!
reviews.title: Five star restaurant with stunning view of castle

reviews.text: Only on the Friday night did we realise why ear plugs were in the room.....! Incredible noise, shouting (football style) til 4amfrom the Grassmarket pubs below!
reviews.title: Great location. Functional hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked in to the hotel for three nights. The hotel is situated in a great area of Edinburgh (Grassmarket) which is pretty much a handy walking distance to many of the main sights. We got to the hotel pretty early (late morning) and were wondering about leaving our luggage at the hotel; the receptionist helpfully advised us that the room was ready for us and gave us a complimentary £10 voucher to use toward drinks and/or meals in the restaurant...so far, so great!
reviews.title: A Bit...Lacking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Then we checked into the room and felt a little deflated. On the positive side = the room is an impressive size, has a nice range of complimentary drinks (different teas, coffee & hot chocolate) and biscuits and has huge windows and a big TV. The shower was lovely (had nice elemis toiletries) and it was great to have non-thief proof hangers and proper glasses. Reception were always helpful, very polite and friendly.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, excellent location - outstanding staff!

reviews.text: On the negative side, the bedroom was a little tatty and could do with sprucing up. The bed was a a bit too soft and lumpy for my liking. Although the room was lovely and bright during the day, the lighting in the room made it feel quite dingy at night. The noise that came from other room doors slamming, loud TVs next door, car alarms going on throughout the night and a lumpy uneven and soft bed made things a little challenging to sleep. The noise outside wouldn't be as bad but there was no air-conditioning so the room was stuffy and too hot with the window closed. The bar area was a little stiff and formal and there was no person to assist with getting the bags up the steps in the hotel or hold the door open.
reviews.title: Great Location, even better view!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not to say that it was a bad experience at all. It's just for the money and for the supposed four star rating I would expect that much more. I have stayed in four star hotels at a similar price elsewhere and been pretty impressed or have stayed in some much cheaper ones and been blown away.
reviews.title: Central, convenient, castle view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel - is great. From arrival - when they did try to enable us to check in early, but were unable to, however they did phone when the room was ready and looked after our bags which we rediscovered in our room. To departure when again they looked after our bags. This hotel was, in my opinion, faultless.
reviews.title: Best Hotel I've Been In So Far!

reviews.text: Fabulous hotel. Clean, practical and stylish rooms. Excellent staff. Try out the restaurants too- superb food and service. Would definitely recommend!
reviews.title: Great Time!

likes.disliked: — Didn't want to leave and go home again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First class hotel .Room was excellent and very clean. Walk in shower an excellent idea.Good view of the castle. Breakfast was superb as was our dinner in the Heights Restaurant. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Excellent value for money and in an ideal location for exploring Edinburgh.
reviews.title: First Class Hotel

likes.liked: — Cleanliness and politeness of all staff.

reviews.title: basic but comfortable
reviews.text: we stayed in the apex international for two nights and enjoyed our stay. the hotel is not plush but this is reflected in the price i guess. there were a few minor annoyances! only one of the two lifts in the hotel was operating for the duration of our stay resulting in long delays. also "the heights resteraunt" which commands spectacular views of the castle is dificult to access for breakfast due to the fact that it seems to fill up rather quickly. unfortunate souls who aren't admitted are directed to a dismal room in the basement which is self-service. on the plus side, the room was comfortable and the location superb due to its proximity to the castle/old town. overall average.

reviews.title: Book Again
reviews.text: From outside we wondered if we had made a mistake, but inside we were warmly greeted by the reception staff, no fuss check in, room was large, 2 queen sized beds, very clean and neat. We had a few drinks at the bar, not at all expensive, then had a room sevice meal, very delicious and resonably priced. A few nice little touches, dressing gown and slippers, pastries by the lift, because there was only 1 lift working. I would strongly recommend this hotel, we had a lovely view of the castle, being on the 3rd floor we had not noticed any traffic noise at all. All the staff were very plesant and believe me, I am not easily pleased!

We have stayed before at the nearby Apex City and booked the Apex International for its location and availability of parking. The room had a good view of the castle and was OK, fairly standard, but the corridors and the room were stiflingly hot and other guests were complaining - this was a very warm day. The in room safe was a joke - not even fixed down. The staff all seemed to be rather tired of their jobs. We went for breakfast and were told it wasn't included in our rate, as I had thought it was, so, not being inclined to pay 13 pounds each for full breakfast we settled for the continental at 9 pounds each - what a rip off! I ordered porridge which was disgusting, lukewarm glutinous and of an inedible instant variety. The coffee arrived in a teapot and the tea in a coffeepot, neither of which looked as if they had been cleaned in years. I had to drink water because the juices all had added sugar (I'm diabetic) and no natural juice was available. Honestly - who buys juice with added sugar? After complaining, the 18 pounds were refunded but I feel sorry for anyone who actually paid that for such an inadequate meal. I wish we had stayed in a B&B where we would have had a superb home-cooked breakfast - guess what we will do next time! Thumbs down for the Apex!
reviews.title: Absolutely appalling breakfast, dreadfully overheated rooms and unsmiling staff

likes.disliked: — Too hot, miserable staff, dreadful breakfast

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is excellent, you couldn’t fault it - right in the city centre with excellent views of the castle (especially from the restaurant on the 5th floor).
reviews.title: Tired and in need of a complete Make-over!

reviews.text: They also give you free Internet access, so top marks there!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel - great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Okay, that’s the good part over with.
reviews.title: Edinburgh delight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel’s car park is a dingy, cramped horse-shoe shaped affair. It certainly looks like a very dodgy place to park; I half expected a car thief to come lurking out from the concrete pillars, were it not for the steady stream of hotel staff coming and going from the grubby staff entrance, for their break/smoke break.
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Nice Rooms, Minimal Spa Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can either struggle with your bags, back out the way that you drove in, around the parking barrier and onto the street front and enter by the main entrance. Or notice the pebble-dashed concrete stairwell and haul your bags up these to arrive on the “terrace’ and then to reception.
reviews.title: Great location, not sure our room was the right one!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Apex for three nights and enjoyed our stay. The Hotel is well located near the Castle and the Royal Mile. We found the staff to be friendly, helpful and efficient. Our room was a good size, well furnished and clean. Breakfast in the top floor dining room overlooking the castle was good without being anything special. There was free access to two internet terminals but access to wi fi was an added cost. We would stay there again.
reviews.title: Good Location and Comfortable Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed overnight whilst at a colleagues wedding on Sat 23rd Sep 2011.
reviews.title: First class hotel in every aspects, get booked now !!

reviews.text: The hotel was perfect in every way, reception staff were very helpful, asked all the right questions and even engaged us on our wedding venue that evening.
reviews.title: Good but seriously warm!

reviews.text: The room was very clean and tidy, everything you would expect from a hotel of this callibre in this fantastic location, we had breakfast in the dining room the next morning overlooking the castle, what more could you ask for ?
reviews.title: For this price you must have air con

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was really nice with good portions, waiting staff were very friendly.
reviews.title: V.Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived 28th Sept for a two night stay. A request to check in early was met along with an upgrade which was very much appreciated. As others' have said, the rooms facing Grassmarket and the Castle are noisy but for me, that's part of being in the hub of a city. The only criticism would be lack of air conditioning. The fan helped but the heat really was overwhelming - more so in the corridors, I really don't know how the housekeeping staff manage. We were disappointed that the Heights restaurant was fully booked when we tried to get in on the second evening so didn't experience this.
reviews.title: Great location, great staff, all round good hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception staff were helpful (especially Barbara). Housekeeping standards in the room were very good. Try Hulas round the corner for a light breakfast. Mariach's mexican wasn't great. Vittoria's on the bridge was lovely. Great live music in The White Hart Inn.
reviews.title: perfectly located for all the sights!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can definitely recommend and will return.
reviews.title: Great Location and close to most things

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: visited this hotel from 28th - 30th september. received a complimentary upgrade to a castle view room and it was amazing, a must for any guest! the room was lovely, clean and spacious. the pool is great - even from here you can still look out to the castle! sauna is a bit pathetic but not a huge miss. negatives would be - no air conditioning, but we had a fan in the room so just put this on 24/7, pillows aren't the best and the shower was a bit grimey but the bath made up for this.
reviews.title: Second stop on a Honeymoon tour around Scotland

reviews.text: the location is the best selling point of this hotel! absolutely spot on. lovely little bars across the road and not too noisy, up a bit of a hill to the castle and some lovely restaurants - i highly recommend The Cellar Door. also a 10 minute walk to princes street for all the main shops and a bus to the zoo.
reviews.title: Good for kids, but only if you book a room without the castle view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights arriving late Sunday and leaving Tuesday, I had requested a room with a view of the castle and the people at the hotel kindly obliged...really impressed.
reviews.title: Great hotel for the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is modern and well furnished, the staff friendly and helpful (save one rather off hand young man in charge of breakfast, has a long way to go as a maitre d' I fear).and it is quite noisy but it is after all a city centre hotel..otherwise an excellent stay.
reviews.title: Fantastic views of the castle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh and beware the Apex City hotel is about 20m up the road on the same street. My other half and I wandered around this hotel for 10 mins trying to figure out where our room was! Too may vodka's I expect.
reviews.title: Stunning location

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights and received a upgrade to a superior room with views of the castle. The staff are very attentive and friendly. The view from the breakfast room is amazing and there is a great choice for breakfast. Will definitely stay here again
reviews.title: Great value, location & service

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in 2012 and had a fabulous couple of nights. There are so many hotels and B&B's in and around Edinburgh and it is difficult to chose in the end I was swayed by this one due to the views and excellent price but had no idea of it's location.
reviews.title: Amazing Location in the Heart of Edinburgh

reviews.text: Our party consisted of 8 females (59+) and we stayed for 2 nights with dinner on first night. Hotel is brilliantly located for the centre of Edinburgh - short walk to Princes Street. Pubs and restaurants directly opposite. Staff were all very friendly and helpful, rooms were sparkling clean and very comfortable with 2 x queen beds, good shower in bathroom. Meal in Metro bistro downstairs lovely on first night and the breakfasts each morning in Heights restaurant on 5th floor looking on to the castle were superb - great choice on menu. Breakfasts were served up to 11 am too!! We used the hotel's pool and sauna, both more than adequate. Bar prices for drinks very reasonable in hotel. Taxis were always ordered quickly and we all got to take a complimentary duck home!! Great hotel ...
reviews.title: Brilliant location

likes.liked: — location, quality of rooms and food

reviews.text: Stayed here for a long weekend to celebrate my 40th birthday Feb 08. Got a free upgrade to a superior room and a couple of free drinks - thanks very much. The White Hart Inn just across the road is to blame for our killer hangovers though. Great pub - live singer on when we went in on the Friday night.
reviews.title: Great weekend at the Apex

likes.liked: — Our view of the castle and the comfy beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fab view of the castle from our room.
reviews.title: Apex International, Edinburgh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only down side was the building works going on in the Grassmarket - some git with a pneumatic drill did not help with my nausea on Sat am. Suppose they will be finished soon...
reviews.title: Unbelievably noisy

reviews.text: Ideal location for Old Town and Royal Mile etc, short cab ride to Waverley Station. Not a huge walk to Princes St/George St for shopping. Also some interesting shops right on the doorstep - Vintage clothing, fossils, hats, cashmere etc....
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is superb, the views of the castle staggering and the rooms spacious. That's the good stuff. The rest of the stay was poor for a 4 star hotel and some travel lodges are cleaner.
reviews.title: Refurb desperately needed - location fantastic

likes.liked: — The view from the rooms and breakfast lounge
likes.disliked: — The smell of the bathrooms and cleanliness problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cleanliness of the bathrooms leaves A LOT to be desired. The shower curtain was mouldy and smelt, tile grouts and silicon were filthy. There was grime all down the side of the bath that you cannot see until you are in it. It is simply not acceptable from a hotel that is meant to be 4 star.
reviews.title: Worth every Penny. Great location. Really friendly. amazing restaurant

reviews.text: All in all the hotel seems to be crying out for a refurb, or at least a deep clean.
reviews.title: Great modern hotel and great location

reviews.text: Right from booking through to checking out, we found that the friendly way we were dealt with, stood out from other hotels we have stayed in.
reviews.title: Go for the Breakfasts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an amazing dinner in the heights restaurant, we would really recommend this. The view of the castle from your table whilst dining was also well worth it.
reviews.title: Value for Money Questionable

description: Located in the heart of Edinburgh’s old town, this contemporary four star hotel has 169 stylish rooms, many with panoramic views of the castle and city skyline. Designed for comfort, the rooms include 42 inch wide screen LCD TV, large desk, free Wi-Fi and local calls, tea and coffee, luxury toiletries, iron and ironing board. Facilities include restaurant, bar, meeting and event space for up to 250 delegates, and pool, tropicarium and gym.
